title: Bois des Lens Quarries
description: A series of opencast limestone quarries located in the Bois des Lens about 25 km west of Nîmes (France) were identified and studied in the 20th century. They are thought to have been brought into use in the fourth century BCE, with peak exploitation occurring during the early Roman Empire.

properties.description: This representative point reflects the label anchor location used for the Bois des Lens on the IGN maps served through the French government's Géoportail website. It has been visually verified in Google Earth. Dates after Bessac.
properties.title: Imagery Location of IGN Representative Point
